metadata.scene_name: Collision between Blocks on a Frictional Surface - Variation 3
metadata.task: Determine how friction alters the collision outcome between two blocks.

answer: Rebound velocity is reduced due to friction.
expected_behavior: Reduced friction still dissipates energy, but rebound is less dampened than in high-friction cases.
reasoning: Less friction means slower energy loss, so post-collision motion persists longer.
